title: Jollof
summary: Jollof, or jollof rice, is a rice dish from West Africa. The dish is typically made with long-grain rice, tomatoes, chilis, onions, spices, and sometimes other vegetables and/or meat in a single pot, although its ingredients and preparation methods vary across different regions. The dish originated in Senegal.

title: Waakye
summary: Waakye is a popular Ghanaian dish consisting of cooked rice and beans, typically black-eyed peas, often with a distinctive purple hue from the sorghum or soum leaves.

title: fufu
summary: Fufu is a traditional West African starchy food made from cassava, yams, or plantains that are boiled, pounded, and molded into a dough.

title: Omo-tuo
summary: Omo tuo is a Ghanaian staple food made with rice. Mostly, 'broken rice' or long grain rice broken into smaller pieces is used.
